file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 21-21-01-04 - SHUTOFF VALVES OF PILOT'S FOOT OUTLETS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL SHUTOFF VALVES OF PILOT'S FOOT OUTLETS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the shutoff valves of the pilot foot outlets. B. The two shutoff valves of the pilot foot outlets are located under the flooring, under the lining of the pedal assemblies. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY SHUTOFF VALVES OF THE PILOT FOOT ALL 21-21-01-000-801-A OUTLETS - REMOVAL SHUTOFF VALVES OF THE PILOT FOOT ALL 21-21-01-400-801-A OUTLETS - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 21-21-01 Page 1 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 21-21-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. SHUTOFF VALVES OF THE PILOT FOOT OUTLETS - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the shutoff valves of the pilot foot outlets. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-12-06-000-801-A/400 PEDAL ASSEMBLY LINING - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Left and right sides of the cockpit I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Remove the pedal assembly lining ( AMM TASK 25-12-06-000-801-A/400). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Release the screws (1) which attach the shutoff valve to the support (11). (2) Remove the tie cables (6) which attach the shutoff valve to the hose (7). (3) Disconnect the hose (7) from the shutoff valve (2). (4) Remove the cotter pin (3), the nut (4), the washer (5) and the screw (8) to release the control cable (9) from the lever (10). (5) Remove the shutoff valve (2). (6) Prevent the hose from dirty particles. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 21-21-01 Page 2 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Shutoff Valves of the Pilot Foot Outlets - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A DET. A ZONES B 123 124 1. SCREW 11. SUPPORT 8. SCREW 9. CONTROL CABLE 2. SHUTOFF VALVE 10. ACTUATING 6. TIE CABLE LEVER 5. WASHER 4. NUT 7. HOSE 3. COTTER PIN DET. B 145AMM210005.MCE C EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 21-21-01 Page 3 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 21-21-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. SHUTOFF VALVES OF THE PILOT FOOT OUTLETS - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the shutoff valves of the pilot foot outlets. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-12-06-400-801-A/400 PEDAL ASSEMBLY LINING - INSTALLATION IPC 21-21-00 COCKPIT DISTRIBUTION IPC 21-21-01 WARM AIR LINE C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Tie cable IPC 21-21-00 2/LRU Cotter pin IPC 21-21-01 1/LRU H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Left and right sides of the cockpit I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Remove the hose protection. Make sure that the hose is clean. (2) Connect the control cable (9) to the lever (10) which operates the shutoff valve and tighten the washer (5) and nut (4) and install its cotter pin (3). (3) Connect the hose (7) to the shutoff valve. (4) Install the tie cables (6) which attach the shutoff valve to the hose (7). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 21-21-01 Page 4 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (5) Put the shutoff valve on its support. (6) Install the screws (1) which attach the valve to the support (11). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install the pedal assembly lining ( AMM TASK 25-12-06-400-801-A/400).
